## <u>**_Webinar Series: On the privilege of turning our world into data_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2021-11-01</p>

Dr Rohan Alexander from University of Toronto will speak on the origins of Data Science, and especially the contributions of Irish statisticians on the field. For more information about this webinar please visit [here](/webinars/posts/2021-12-16-webinar10/). 




## <u>**_Webinar Series: Estimating energy allocation between somatic and gonadic growth_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2021-11-01</p>

[Dr Hideyasu Shimadzu](https://www.lboro.ac.uk/departments/maths/staff/hideyasu-shimadzu/) from Loughborough University, UK will speak on the nature of the challenges associated with quantifying the growth patterns and energy allocation strategies of living organisms and the interactions with broader biological communities in which they reside. For more information about this webinar please visit [here](/webinars/posts/2021-11-12-webinar9/). 

For registration please visit [here](https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/y-isa-webinar-series-energy-allocation-between-somatic-and-gonadic-growth-tickets-203112684507).

## <u>**_Webinar Series: Assessing the impact of deprivation and ethnicity on COVID burden in England_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2021-09-26</p>

[Dr. Tullia Padellini](https://tulliapadellini.github.io/) from Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics, School of Public Health, Imperial College London will speak on how the ethnically diverse and deprived communities have been differentially affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in the UK by assessing three different metrics of COVID-19 burden (test positivity, prevalence and vaccination rates). For more information about this webinar please visit [here](/webinars/posts/2021-10-14-webinar8/). 

For registration please visit [here](https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/y-isa-webinar-series-the-impact-of-deprivation-and-ethnicity-on-covid-tickets-179481081747).

## <u>**_Webinar Series: Clustering Big Data with Mixed Features_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2020-12-02</p>

Joshua Tobin from the School of Computer Science & Statistics, Trinity College Dublin, will introduce a new clustering method for large mixed attribute datasets which adapts and extends the popular peak-finding technique. The algorithm presented is competent at deciding the correct number of clusters and executes with subquadratic complexity. For more information about this webinar please click [here](/webinars/posts/2020-12-10-webinar2/). 

For registration please click [here](https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/y-isa-webinar-series-clustering-big-data-with-mixed-features-tickets-131319198257).

## <u>**_Webinar Series: Global Short-Term Forecasting of Covid-19 Cases_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2020-10-29</p>

[Dr. Thiago de Paula Oliveira](https://prof-thiagooliveira.netlify.com/) from the Roslin Institute, University of Edinburgh will speak on a new modelling framework of COVID-19 to forecast the number of cases, study the effects of covariates (such as lockdown policies), and generate forecasts for smaller regions within countries and up to six days ahead. For more information about this webinar please click [here](/webinars/posts/2020-11-12-webinar1/). 

For registration please click [here](https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/y-isa-webinar-series-global-short-term-forecasting-of-covid-19-cases-tickets-127039764355).

## <u>**_Twitter Poster Conference (#YISAPoster2020)_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2020-05-21</p>

The **#YISAPoster2020** Twitter Conference will be held entirely online over [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Young_Stats_ISA) and aims to provide an opportunity for Statistician and Data Scientist around the world to meet online, share thier research and engage in scientific debate. For more information on how to join the **#YISAPoster2020** event please visit [here](/events/2020-07-15-poster-conference-2020/).

## <u>**_Inaugural Young-ISA Meeting_**</u>
<p style="font-size:15px">Updated on 2019-09-01</p>
This inaugural event will gather together early career statisticians from across Ireland for a series of talks on career development in academia and industry. Keynote talks will be given by established professionals in both fields with the remainder of the two sessions devoted to showcasing some of the research projects conducted in universities across Ireland by postgraduate and post-doctoral researchers.

**Invited Speakers:**<br>
Dr. Norma Bargary, Lecturer in Statistics, University of Limerick. <br>
Dr. Aidan Boland, Senior Data Scientist, Edge by Ascential. <br>

The event is **free of charge** to attend and is open to all early career statisticians (including postgraduate and PhD students, postdoctoral researchers and lecturers) and all ISA members. 

Read more [here](/events/2019-09-01-inaugural-meeting/).
